IOT.IOTServer.UDPListener

Class UDPListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • IOT.IOTServer.UDPListener.UDPListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UDPListenerInterface, java.lang.Runnable

    public class UDPListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements UDPListenerInterface
    The UDP Listener is responsible for receiving service offerings which are regularly sent out by the UDP Broadcast Service.
    Version:
    Milestone1
    Author:
    Mai

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.Integer port
      The port on which to listen.
      private IOTServerInterface receiverServer
      The server to whom the received datagram data are forwarded.
      private java.lang.Boolean running
      True indicates the listener is actively listening for Datagrams on the specified port.
      private java.net.DatagramSocket socket
      The socket to which the listening is bound.

    • Field Detail

      • port

        private java.lang.Integer port
        The port on which to listen.

      • socket

        private java.net.DatagramSocket socket
        The socket to which the listening is bound. Defaults to null until the run-method is called.

      • running

        private java.lang.Boolean running
        True indicates the listener is actively listening for Datagrams on the specified port. False indicates the listener has stopped, either by the method terminate() terminate) or by an error. Default is false (null if constructor has not been called yet).

      • receiverServer

        private IOTServerInterface receiverServer
        The server to whom the received datagram data are forwarded.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UDPListener

        public UDPListener(@NotNull
                   java.lang.Integer port,
                   @NotNull
                   IOTServerInterface receiverServer)
        Create a new instance of UDPListener. It automatically sets "listening" to false; "socket" will be initialized by the "run" method.
        Parameters:
        port - The port on which to Listen.
        receiverServer - The server to whom the recieved datagram data are forwarded.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This methods starts the listener on the port specified in the constructor. The listener will continue running until it is terminated by external methods or errors. This method can only be called ONCE.
        Specified by:
        run in interface UDPListenerInterface
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the run-method has already been called before.

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminates the listener by setting "running" to false. Also does resource cleanup.
        Specified by:
        terminate in interface UDPListenerInterface

      • getPort

        public java.lang.Integer getPort()

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the listener's state (if running, and if known, on which address)

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Debug method.
